required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-Label Extension Study of BION-1301 in IgA Nephropathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-Label Extension (OLE) Study for Patients With Immunoglobulin A Nephropathy (IgAN) Who Participated in A Prior Clinical Study of BION-1301

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label extension (OLE) study to evaluate the safety, pharmacokinetics (PK), pharmacodynamics (PD), and clinical activity of BION-1301 in adults with IgA nephropathy

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a Phase 2, multicenter, open-label extension (OLE) study of BION-1301, a first-in-class humanized IgG4 anti-a proliferation-inducing ligand (APRIL) monoclonal antibody.
Patients who previously participated in Study ADU-CL-19 (NCT03945318) will receive open-label treatment with BION-1301 for up to approximately 2 years. Study participants will receive BION-1301 at the same dose, route, and dosing schedule as they received in ADU-CL-19. Dose, route, and/or dosing schedule may be changed during the OLE study based on a review by the Safety Review Team of all available PK, PD, and clinical activity data from previous and ongoing studies of BION-1301.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs) as assessed by the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until end of treatment, up to approximately 2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with serious adverse events (SAEs) as assessed by NCI-CTCAE
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until end of treatment, up to approximately 2 years

primary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in safety laboratory parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until end of treatment, up to approximately 2 years
primary_outcome.description: Number of safety laboratory parameters reported as adverse events

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until end of treatment, up to approximately 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Serum-time profiles and population PK parameters

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterize the pharmacodynamic effect of BION-1301
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until end of treatment, up to approximately 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in immunoglobulin levels (IgA, IgG, IgM levels)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until end of treatment, up to approximately 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of anti-drug antibodies (ADAs) and neutralizing antibodies (NAbs)

other_outcome.measure: Evaluate the preliminary clinical activity of BION-1301 in patients with IgAN
other_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until end of treatment, up to approximately 2 years
other_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in estimated glomerular filtration rate (eGFR), urinary protein/creatinine ratio (UPCR), urinary albumin/creatinine ratio (UACR), and corresponding urinary protein, albumin, and creatinine levels

arm_group.description: BION-1301 will be administered once every 2 weeks (Q2W) as an intravenous infusion.
BION-1301 will be administered once every 4 weeks (Q4W) as an intravenous infusion.

intervention.description: A solution for IV infusion administered as multiple doses

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participated in Study ADU-CL-19 and received at least 5 of 7 doses if enrolled in Cohort 1 (dosed once every 2 weeks) and 3 of 4 doses if enrolled in Cohort 2 (dosed once every 4 weeks).
- Male or female â‰¥18 years old at Screening
- Males must agree to follow the protocol-specified contraception guidance throughout the study (from Screening through 10 weeks after the final dose of study drug)
- Women of child-bearing potential (WOCBP) must agree to follow the protocol-specified contraception guidance throughout the study (from Screening through 10 weeks after the final dose of study drug)
- Able to provide signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received systemic corticosteroid therapy (> 10 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent) or any other form of immunosuppressive therapy within 3 months prior to the first dose of study drug
- Female who is breastfeeding
- Type 1 or 2 diabetes
- Current malignancy or history of malignancy during the last 3 years
- Known or suspected allergy or hypersensitivity to any component of BION-1301, or history of severe hypersensitivity reaction to any monoclonal antibody
